intro: Kibara borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean kibara, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
